results.title: The Best of the Addams Family. -Volume 5
results.brief_description: The creepy and kooky Addams family; Gomez, Morticia, Uncle Fester, Grandmama, Thing, Lurch, Pugsley and Wednesday are here for two episodes from the original television series. In “Green-eyed Gomez” Gomez suffers from a bout of jealousy when a former beau of Morticias, Lionel Barker (Del Moore), comes to stay. In an effort to keep his advances away from his wife Gomez hires a maid (Pattee Chapman) as a decoy but the jealousy is reversed when Morticia mistakes his actions for those of effection. To complicate matters Lionel proves to be a con-man. Directed by Jerry Hopper. In “Wednesday leaves home” Wednesday does a disappearing trick after being scolded for borrowing Uncle Fester’s TNT. A frantic Morticia and Gomez contact the Bureau of Missing Persons, only to discover that Wednesday was hiding in her room but the problems continue for Sergeant Haley (Jesse White) and Officer Thompson (Rex Kelloss) when they become involved with the Addams family. Directed by Sidney Lanfield. The series features John Astin, Carolyn Jones, Ted Cassidy, Jackie Coogan and Lisa Loring and based on characters created by Charles Addams.

results.title: The Best of the Addams Family. -Volume 4
results.brief_description: The creepy and kooky Addams family; Gomez, Morticia, Uncle Fester, Grandmama, Thing, Lurch, Pugsley and Wednesday are here for two episodes from the original television series. In “New neighbors meet the Addams family”, newlyweds Hubert and Amanda Peterson’s (Peter Brooks and Cynthia Pepper) honeymoon begins on a sour note when they move into the house next door to the Addams family. Alarmed by Fester tunneling into their house, Grandmama grinding the axe and Morticia and Gomez bathing the octopus, they must grin and bear it in an attempt to move out of the house. Directed by Jean Yarbrough. In “Morticia, the matchmaker”, Melancholia (Hazel Shermet), Morticia’s cousin, comes to visit after yet another future husband flees to join the Foreign Legion. After Gomez exhausts the list of eligible batchelors; a marriage broker, Lurch plus other business contacts, Melancholia sets her heart on a woman shy lawyer, Clarence P. Harvey (Lee Goodman) who has relutantly come to visit Gomez on business. Directed by Jerry Hopper. The series features

results.brief_description: A feast of amazing animation from MTV’s ‘Liquid Television’ which features animated comics, live actors in animated settings and short films from a host of artists and multimedia creators.

results.title: The Best of Gillies (Captioned)
results.brief_description: The Gillies Team takes on numerous national treasures (including Bob Hawke, Andrew Peacock, Wran the Man and Don Chipp) and even the odd megabuck personality such as Rupert Murdoch in this new compilation video selected from the hilarious Gillies Report series. Highlights include Bob Hawke as the Invisible Man: the Maralinga Commission (or Wise After the Event) re-enacted in the form of a cabaret, with Mr. Justice McLelland chairing the proceedings in sparkling silver lurex; and John Clarke - posing as a sports announcer - introduces us to the magnificent game of Farnarkeling. Featuring: Max Gillies, John Clarke, Patricia Cooke, Tracey Harvey, Don Watson, Geoff Kelso, Wendy Harmer & Phillip Scott. Rated: PG

results.title: The Best of friends
results.creator_credit: New South Wales Film Corporation, Friendly Film Productions, Tom Jeffrey and Michael Robertson
results.brief_description: Angela Punch McGregor and Graeme Blundell star as two old school friends who have known one another since childhood, and have shared personal triumphs and crises. Overnight, their relationship dramatically changes from friends to lovers. A once beautiful relationship is threatened, and the complication of an unexpected pregnancy throws them both into a spin! A light romantic comedy with a strong supporting cast including Ruth Cracknell, Henri Szeps and Mark Lee.

results.title: The Best of Dr Seuss
results.brief_description: Three funny animated children’s stories from the brilliantly playful mind of Dr Seuss (less commonly known as Theodor Geisel). “Butter battle book” (prod. Ralph Bakshi) - the tale of two groups of people, the Zooks and the Yooks, at war over the issue of which side is the correct one to butter bread on. An amusing parable about intolerance and arrogance. “Daisy-Head Mayzie” (prod. Christopher O’Hare, dir. Tony Collingwood)- a lovely young lady, named Mayzie, discovers a daisy growing out the top of her head. Her schoolteachers and townsfolk are thrown into a flap about what to do with poor Mayzie, who learns a lesson about the perils of fame and money, and the importance of family. “Horton hatches the egg” (prod. Leon Schlesinger, dir. Robert Clampett) - Horton, a kind-hearted elephant, agrees to sit on an unhatched egg for a mother bird named Maisy, who is in need of a holiday. When the lazy Maisy decides she likes it too much at the beach, the ever-faithful Horton sits on the egg through thick and thin, determined to hatch it safely, despite bad weather and the ridicule of his friends. These animated tales, imbued with gentle humour, and the rhyming prose of Dr Seuss, should prove a delight to children.

results.title: The Best of Dad's army. Vol. 2 [DVD]
results.creator_credit: BBC, David Croft and Harold Snoad
results.brief_description: Popular comic English television program “Dad’s army”, which ran for nine years, is about numerous men that comprise the local division of the Home Guard in the seaside town of Walmington-on-Sea during World War 2. The men are an eccentric lot who range in age from the very young to the decidedly doddery. In each episode the group muddle their way through a different situation in their won idiosyncratic way. Episodes on this DVD include: “No spring for Frazer” (1969, 30 mins) Frazer looses the spring from Captain Mainwaring’s machine gun, which may have ended up in Mr Blewitt’s coffin. “Mum’s army” (1970, 31 mins) Captain Mainwaring recruits women-folk to help fight the Nazis. “Menace from the deep” (1969, 30 mins) The Home Guard is manning the machine gun post, Pike’s lost the boat and the food, and the platoon is nearly blown sky high. “When did you last see your money?” (1972, 30 mins) Jones causes mayhem at the bank when he tries to pay half a pound of sausages into his account. “The Honourable man” (1973, 31 mins) When Sergeant Wilson loses a relative he finds himself on the outer fringes of the aristocracy, much to the chagrin of Mainwaring.

results.title: The Best of Dad's army
results.brief_description: Popular comic English television program “Dad’s army”, which ran for nine years, is about numerous men that comprise the local division of the Home Guard in the seaside town of Walmington-on-Sea during World War 2. The men are an eccentric lot who range in age from the very young to the decidedly doddery. In each episode the group muddle their way through a different situation in their own idiosyncratic way. Episodes on this DVD include: “The Deadly attachment” (1973, 30 mins) The platoon are ordered to guard a captive German U-Boat crew. “Keep young and beautiful” (1972, 30 mins) Concern over the condition of some of the elder members of the unit precipitates a frenzy of invigorating activities. “Never too old” (1972, 36 mins) Jones falls in love and becomes increasingly absent-minded much to the dismay of his cohorts. “Asleep in the deep” (1972, 30 mins) A bomb falls on the local plumbing station; Privates Walker and Godfrey require rescuing but typically the entire platoon become trapped. “Sons of the sea” (1973, 30 mins) Captain Mainwaring plans to patrol the rivers in order to keep the Nazis at bay.

results.title: The Best of Bowie
results.brief_description: This disc contains 47 film clips of British singer and musician David Bowie. Bowie, who has experienced an illustrious career, has always been at the forefront of trends and new waves in music and fashion. These clips spanning a thirty-year career, reflect Bowie’s chameleon personality and the diversity of his art. The music videos are directed by a variety of people including Mick Rock, D.A. Pennebaker, Stanley Dorfman, David Mallet, Jim Yukich, Julien Temple, Steve Barron, Mark Romanek, Gus Van Sant, Jean Baptiste-Mondino, Roger Michell, Floria Sigismondi and Walter Stern. Other songs have live clips, which serve as a fascinating reflection of the changing face of music over the decades. Songs include: Oh! You Pretty Things; Queen Bitch; Five Years; Starman; John, I’m Only dancing; The Jean Genie; Space Oddity; Drive-In Saturday; Life On Mars?; Ziggy Stardust; Rebel Rebel; Young Americans; Be My Wife; Heroes; Boys Keep Swinging; D.J.; Look Back In Anger; Ashes To Ashes; Fashion; Wild Is The Wind; Let’s Dance; China Girl; Modern Love; Cat People (Putting Out Fire); Blue Jean; Loving The Alien; Dancing In The Street; Absolute Beginners; Underground; As The World Falls Down; Day-In Day-Out; Time Will Crawl; Never Let Me Down; Fame 90; Jump They Say; Black Tie White Noise; Miracle Goodnight; Buddha Of Suburbia; The Hearts Filthy Lesson; Strangers When We Meet; Hallo Spaceboy; Little Wonder; Dead Man Walking; Seven Years In Tibet; I’m Afraid Of Americans; Thursday’s Child and Survive.

results.title: The Best of Big Brother
results.creator_credit: Southern Star Entertainment, Endemol Entertainment, Lara Hopkins, Andrew Farrell and Simon Francis
results.brief_description: Big Brother is the history-making reality television program that was franchised around the world and quickly became a phenomenon when first broadcast in Australia. The program celebrates the excesses of the reality television genre and delivers the ultimate promise to would-be-voyeurs by filming it’s ‘contestants’ constantly for the duration of the show (with the help of 23 cameras). The program, run as a winner takes-all competition, placed twelve strangers in a house (six girls and six boys) to live with each other for a period of three months (85 days). A set of rules were put in place, along with a number of set tasks (or challenges) that had to be completed (or performed) by the house-mates. Each week a house-mate would be voted off by the public from the show, whilst the competition grew and the public interest intensified to a dramatic climax that revealed the final winner. Relive the fun, drama, screams, precocious parading and much un-scripted antics of the original twelve that dared show us all how they could cope under 24 hour surveillance! Hosted by Greta Kileen.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Southern Star Entertainment, Endemol Entertainment, Lara Hopkins, Andrew Farrell and Simon Francis

The program celebrates the excesses of the reality television genre and delivers the ultimate promise to would-be-voyeurs by filming it’s ‘contestants’ constantly for the duration of the show (with the help of 23 cameras). The program, run as a winner takes-all competition, placed twelve strangers in a house (six girls and six boys) to live with each other for a period of three months (85 days). A set of rules were put in place, along with a number of set tasks (or challenges) that had to be completed (or performed) by the house-mates. Each week a house-mate would be voted off by the public from the show, whilst the competition grew and the public interest intensified to a dramatic climax that revealed the final winner. Relive the fun, drama, screams, precocious parading and much un-scripted antics of the original twelve that dared show us all how they could cope under 24 hour surveillance! Hosted by Greta Kileen.
description_for_label: Big Brother is the history-making reality television program that was franchised around the world and quickly became a phenomenon when first broadcast in Australia. The program celebrates the excesses of the reality television genre and delivers the ultimate promise to would-be-voyeurs by filming it’s ‘contestants’ constantly for the duration of the show (with the help of 23 cameras). The program, run as a winner takes-all competition, placed twelve strangers in a house (six girls and six boys) to live with each other for a period of three months (85 days). A set of rules were put in place, along with a number of set tasks (or challenges) that had to be completed (or performed) by the house-mates. Each week a house-mate would be voted off by the public from the show, whilst the competition grew and the public interest intensified to a dramatic climax that revealed the final winner. Relive the fun, drama, screams, precocious parading and much un-scripted antics of the original twelve that dared show us all how they could cope under 24 hour surveillance! Hosted by Greta Kileen.
